column1: 2024-09-17T22:52:36Z,8530,,LS AI TP VJ,,newgraph_lschick,8530,newgraph_airvine,,,,45,Sandstone creek ,McDonnell fsr,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,2.4,38,"Nice dream with good habitat. Pools present for overwintering, fish and gravel suitable for spawning. Rainbow, cutthroat, and Dolly Parton caught during sampling. Very large culvert with lots of road fill.          ",,2024-09-17T22:52:36Z,9,582719,6073883,No,,,No,,9,0.5,0.4,No,5,3.9,2,No,Yes,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,No,Yes,No,,1,1,1,3,"Culvert is in good shape, no blockage. A little bit of erosion under pipe at outlet                      ",1,1,1,4,"Culvert is massive, flood would not be an issue.           ",1,1,3,2,10,5,22,26,"Low traffic FSR, but a huge amount of road fill so construction would be expensive and difficult. Fish bearing stream with great habitat so replacement priority is high. Environmental impact also high because itâ€™s a fish bearing stream.          ",ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_155416.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_161114.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_155939.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_161116.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_155933.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_155937.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240917_161857.jpg,,,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-09-18T21:53:45Z,198935,,LS,,newgraph_lschick,198935,newgraph_lschick,,,,358,Tributary to Knapper Creek ,Gold creek fsr ,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,1.2,20,"Culvert is falling apart at Inlet. Huge outlet pool that was fished, see fish card. Stream flows out of outlet pool on left-hand side into a nice channel with gravel suitable for spawning and some pools. Good stream. Decent amount of road fill.          ",,2024-09-18T21:53:45Z,9,636440,6020756,No,,,No,,4,0.15,0.8,No,1.5,0,0,Yes,Yes,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,No,No,Yes,high,1,1,1,3,"Barrel at Inlet is falling apart. No erosion issues.
,2,1,2,5,Culvert is massive, but there is a large outlet pool indicating culvert may be undersized for stream. Culvert might not handle a flood.          ",1,1,6,5,10,5,28,33,"Decent amount

",ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_145449.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_145453.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_150507.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_145456.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_145451.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_150354.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_151215.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240918_150403.jpg,,,Channel from outlet ,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-09-19T19:18:58Z,195943,,LS ,,newgraph_lschick,195943,newgraph_lschick,1755230,,,363,Stock creek ,Barrett station rd,,,Closed Bottom Structure,Oval Culvert,,2.2,14,"Extremely big outlet drop, and outlet of culvert shows signs of high flows. Really nice dream which likely has lots of pools at higher flows, but very low flows at time of assessment. Stream flows through agricultural land on both sides and is very very eroded downstream, would be a great place for fencing and reparian management. only two fish caught during sampling, which was surprisingly given the nice habitat. Conductivity was extremely high, perhaps due to cattle upstream and in the area. ",,2024-09-19T19:18:58Z,9,645439,6035050,No,,,No,,0.4,1.05,0.6,No,1.5,2.6,2,No,Yes,Deep Fill,Medium,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_lschick,No,Yes,,mod,1,2,1,4,Some embankment fell erosion on outlet side of road near the culvert.          ,1,3,3,7,"Culvert is massive and the outlet of the culvert show signs of high flows therefore, the stream likely already handles lots of water, so a flood would not be detrimental, but agricultural fields downstream could be affected by flood.          ",5,2,8,7,10,5,37,44,"Road is used to access quite a few houses and there was consistent local traffic while doing assessment. Not much Road fill s

o construction would be easy, but paved road and would inhibit access to residence.          Fish captured while sampling.           ",ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_122912.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_122917.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_122925.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_122920.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_122914.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_122923.jpg,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240919_124131.jpg,,,,,,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

2024-09-20T20:15:50Z,,1805555,AI,,newgraph_airvine,1805555,newgraph_airvine,,,,54,Simpson Creek,Railway,,CN Rail,Closed Bottom Structure,Round Culvert,,3,25," Although this culvert is on Simpson Creek, it does not currently pass the main flow. Discovered is primarily dry at this time. Itâ€™s fully embedded. there are 21.5 m pipes under the railway. Farther north pipe currently is passing all the water. Southern pipe is fully embedded and average of 25 cm. High value stream with extensive areas of gravel, suitable for steelhead and coal, and Chinook spawning upstream. Adjacent landowner reports observed recent spawning of steelhead and historic knowledge of Chinook spawning at location approximately 300 m downstream from Nielsen Road.                    ",,2024-09-20T20:15:50Z,9,614941,6075232,No,20,Yes,No,,1,0.05,0.9,Yes,2,5,1,Yes,Yes,Deep Fill,High,,,,,,,,,,,,newgraph_airvine,Yes,No,Yes,low,1,1,1,3,"Pipes are quite rusty, but generally tire crossing is in good condition          ",1,2,2,5,Overall of 3 m combines diameter of the two pipes is quite under size for the stream however because gradients are so low it seems unlikely to wash out the real grade          ,,1,2,1,10,1,,,"Railway so related to transportation of goods versus community access. Apparently it is extremely expensive and difficult to remediate cross on the railway, definitely a salmon and steelhead stream.          ",ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_134645.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_134012.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_134641.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_134017.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_134009.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_134638.jpg,,,,,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_140931.jpg,ignore_mobile/photos/20240920_141001.jpg,,Outlet2,Barrel2,,"<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC ""-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0//EN"" ""http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/strict.dtd"">

Length of pipe and gradients estimated two of the pipes are appear to be fully embedded with one slightly elevated from the others approximately 30 cm. Stream is channelized with large boulders throughout this entire property. Material from beavers in the inlet and three dimes ranging from .4 to 1 m high within 150 m upstream.
